definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: But I tell you that anyone who is angry with his brother [2] will be subject to judgment.
sentences.chinese: 只是我告诉你们，凡向弟兄动怒的，难免受审判。

sentences.english: Very easily offended, you do not want to insult a hippogriff .
sentences.chinese: 很容易动怒，因此你们不要想侮辱一只鹰马。

sentences.english: Then he said, "May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak."
sentences.chinese: 亚伯拉罕说，求主不要动怒，容我说。

sentences.english: When it is called for, give us the kind of anger that builds up and does not tear down.
sentences.chinese: 在有需要动怒时，赐我们那建立而非拆毁的怒气。

sentences.english: Three younger sister four younger sister saw his mother angry, imagine usual pass the buck to each other.
sentences.chinese: 三妹四妹见母亲动怒，想像往常一样把责任推给对方。

sentences.english: The bellows puffed on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 风箱能扇火，言语可动怒。

sentences.english: Please don’t take offense; I just want to tell you what I think.
sentences.chinese: 请别动怒，我只是想告诉你我所想的而已。

sentences.english: You need not flare up merely because I mentioned your work.
sentences.chinese: 你大可不必因为我提到你的工作就动怒。

definition: to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to vent one's anger on an innocent party (idiom)
to forget one's manners/to forget oneself/to lose self-control (in a situation)
to let emotions affect one's decisions
